blocks.title: Nigerian man produce generator wey dey run on water

synopses.short: Nigerian man produce generator wey dey run on water
synopses.long:
As Nigeria authorities still dey try to find solutions to light mata, 26-year old Emeka Nelson don find di solution.
Wetin ginger am na im friend wey smoke from generator kill. dis one come make Emeka to produce generator wey go dey runs on water.
BBC carri waka go Awka Anambra state inside South-east Nigeria go see di ogbonge invention.
Nelson no be certified engineer. dem born am under one tree for village, E struggled to read for elementary school, work as house help for di age of 5, and no get any university education.
Im house full with Structural drawings and designs wey e pin for wall and na so e dey take im time dey study di drawing.
For 16 years, e dey focus to make im dream turn to something real-dat na to make generator wey go run on water.
E gey most of di materials wey im use take make im generator from scrap.
Di first generator wey im do explode wen e test am. dis come make am dey doubt di project but afta plenti years of struggle e come get am right.
Nelson says im generator get maximum output capacity of 1,000 watts and di voltage dey fluctuate between 220 and 240.
E say one litre of clean water fit power di generator for 6 hours, and e no go bring out smoke like oda generators, e dey environment friendly.
Nelson say im dream na for di generator to dey for millions of homes all ova di world.
synopses.medium: Emeka Nelson don find di solution to di light palava wey dey worry for Nigeria nad oda parts of Africa as im produce generator wey dey run on water.

blocks.caption: Nigerian man produce generator wey dey run on water

blocks.text: As Nigeria authorities still dey try to find solution to light mata, e be like say 26-year old Emeka Nelson don find di solution afta im produce generator wey go dey run on water
Wetin ginger Emeka na im friend wey smoke from generator kill.

headlines.shortHeadline: How light companies dey use estimated billing show Nigerians pepper
headlines.headline: How light companies dey use estimated billing show Nigerians pepper
headlines.overtyped: How light companies dey use estimated billing show Nigerians pepper

meta.summary: Lawmakers for Nigeria wan make am crime for light companies to use guesswork give customer estimated bill.

headlines.headline: Nigeria: Wetin 5,222 megawatts electric fit do?

meta.summary: Di Transmission Company of Nigeria and di vice-president office carry tori come outside say electric power wey di country produce don increase pass before as e reach 5,222 megawatts dis December.

blocks.text: BBC carri waka go Awka Anambra state inside South-east Nigeria go see di ogbonge invention wey Nelson produce.
Nelson wey no be certified engineer struggle to read for elementary school, work as house help for di age of 5, and no get any university education.
Wen we go im house, e dey full with Structural drawings and designs wey e pin for wall and na so e dey take im time dey study di drawing.
For 16 years, e dey focus to make im dream turn to something real-dat na to make generator wey go run on water.
Most of di material wey Nelson take arrange im generator na from  scrap.
Di first generator wey im do explode wen e test am. Dis come make am dey doubt di project but afta plenti years of struggle e come get am right.
Nelson says im generator get maximum output capacity of 1,000 watts and di voltage dey fluctuate between 220 and 240.
E say one litre of clean water fit power di generator for 6 hours, and e no go bring out smoke like oda generators, e dey environment friendly.
Dis ogbonge inventor add say im dream na for di generator to dey for millions of homes all ova di world.

headlines.shortHeadline: Nigerian man produce generator wey dey use water
headlines.headline: Nigerian man Emeka Nelson don produce generator wey dey use only water

headlines.shortHeadline: Meet boys who dey convert cassava to electricity
headlines.headline: Meet boys who dey convert cassava to electricity

promos.summary: James den Kwesi Ansah want convert most of Ghana's cassava waste into cheap electricity supply for schools, hospitals den villages.

indexImage.altText: Kwesi and James dey check radio
indexImage.caption: James Ansah den Kwesi Ansah dey experiment plus dema electricity inovation from cassava

headlines.headline: Nigeria: Wetin 5,222 megawatts electric fit do?

promos.summary: Di Transmission Company of Nigeria and di vice-president office carry tori come outside say electric power wey di country produce don increase pass before as e reach 5,222 megawatts dis December.

indexImage.caption: If each person get TV, AC, bulb and fridge for Nigeria, dis 5,222 megawatts no go fit serve di country.
